security: Revealing the true identities of individuals involved in operational roles, such as General Hardin, could potentially expose past intelligence-gathering activities and compromise the individuals involved. Quoting directly: "Hardin as an Air Force General who was being placed with Pan Am for operational reasons, primarily technical information collection."
security_level: RETURN TO CIA Background Use Only Do Not Reproduce
summary: A memorandum for the record detailing a conversation with Mr. George Carey about a 1955 memorandum referring to T. and H., which were identified as Juan Trippe and General Hardin, respectively; also confirms General Hardin was placed with Pan Am for operational reasons.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 4, 1969, Lawrence R. Houston, General Counsel, documented a conversation with Mr. George Carey to clarify a 1955 memorandum referencing 'T' and 'H'. Through speculation and further confirmation from Mrs. Lovejoy and Mr. Larocque, 'T' was identified as Juan Trippe and 'H' as General Thomas O. Hardin, an Air Force Major General placed with Pan Am for operational reasons, specifically technical information collection. The memo also clarifies that Mr. Carey had no knowledge of the Itkin case and that General Hardin is not synonymous with Philip Harbin.
title: MEMORANDUM FOR THE RECORD
